conclusion: The problem involves a current balance used to measure the magnetic induction intensity of a uniform magnetic field. A rectangular coil with n turns, horizontal side length L, and current I is placed in the field. The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the coil. When the current is reversed, an additional weight m is required to balance the system.

premise: The force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = nBIl.
conclusion: The force on each side of the coil is F = nBIl.

premise: The coil has two sides experiencing force due to the magnetic field.
conclusion: The total force on the coil is F_total = 2nBIl.

premise: When the current is reversed, the direction of the force on each side of the coil is reversed.
conclusion: The total force on the coil when the current is reversed is F'_total = -2nBIl.

premise: Initially, the system is balanced. After reversing the current, an additional weight m is required to balance the system.
conclusion: The difference in forces is equal to the weight of the additional mass: |F_total - F'_total| = mg.

premise: Substitute F_total = 2nBIl and F'_total = -2nBIl into |F_total - F'_total| = mg.
Compare the derived formula B = mg / (4nIl) with the ground truth formula B = mg / (2nIL).
conclusion: The derived formula does not match the ground truth formula.
